intro: Staphidium tiliifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved woolly shieldflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
